title: Drawing
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash
markings: Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d)
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Horizontal rectangle. Five-sixth shown. Sheaves are connected above by drapery festoons, below by scrolls to form three compartments. The lateral ones are decorated with plants rising between the scrolls. A cross hangs in the central panel. The framing border is divided into oblongs and squares at the corners. Colored background.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing.
Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-1481.
